column4: hello ! Could the commands 'sudo apt-get install xinetd' or 'sudo apt-get update' mess up a Ubuntu server that has web, sftp, ssh, vnc and samba installed?
it would depend on what is being updated and what xinetd is set to serve
it may be an unrelated issue, like IP addresses changing or firewalling
xinetd/inetd wouldn't really intefere when it uses its default config
